intro: Crotalaria subcapitata, commonly known as the small-headed crownflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years. Crotalaria subcapitata is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
